subparagraph.content: makes any statement, or gives any particular or information, from which he knows that any material particular has been omitted,

subsection.continued: the person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

subsection.content: Where a person is liable for the payment of a fine imposed under subsection (1) or (2) in relation to a specified licence, for the purposes of a scheme of control agreement, the fine is not to be taken to be part of the operating cost incurred by the person in relation to the specified process to which the licence relates.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—

def.name: OperatingCost
def.leadIn: operating cost (經營費用) means any cost directly or indirectly incurred in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the generation, transmission, distribution or sale of electricity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: energy efficiency or conservation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: reduction of air pollution;

subsection.def: scheme of control agreement (管制計劃協議), in relation to a person, means an agreement entered into by the Government with the person (whether or not with any other person) that, among other things, provides for the calculation of the amount of return allowed to the person by reference to matters including the operating cost incurred by the person in relation to the specified process to which the relevant specified licence relates.

part.name: P5A
part.heading: Issue of Closure Notices for Suspected Contravention of Section 13

section.name: s30C
section.heading: Interpretation of Part VA
section.def: closure notice (封閉通知) means a notice issued under section 30D(1);
specified person (指明人士), in relation to any premises used for the conduct of a specified process, means the person who conducts the specified process on the premises;
subject premises (標的處所), in relation to a closure notice issued in respect of any premises, means the premises.

subsection.content: If the Authority has reasonable cause to believe that an offence under section 13 has been committed or is being committed in respect of any premises, the Authority may issue a notice in respect of the premises.

subsection.leadIn: The closure notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is to contain the following information—

subparagraph.content: the name and address of the specified person of the subject premises;
the address or location of the subject premises;
a description of the specified process to which the offence relates;
the date on which the closure notice comes into force; and

the right of the specified person to apply for the cancellation of the closure notice under section 30N and a person aggrieved by the closure notice to appeal under section 31 against the decision to issue the closure notice.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the closure notice is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: served on the specified person of the subject premises in accordance with section 30E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affixed at a conspicuous place on the subject premises by the Authority.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), the Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify the form of the closure notice.
A notice published under subsection (4) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of a closure notice is served on the specified person of any subject premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering the copy personally to the specified person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by leaving the copy at the last known place of business or residence of the specified person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending the copy by post addressed to the last known place of business or residence of the specified person.

subsection.content: If the specified person of the subject premises is a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), a copy of a closure notice may also be served on the specified person by serving the copy in the manner described in section 803 of that Ordinance as if it were a process or notice required to be served on a registered non-Hong Kong company under that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If the specified person of the subject premises is a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), a copy of a closure notice may also be served on the specified person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by leaving the copy at the registered office of the specified person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending the copy by post addressed to the registered office of the specified person.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the closure notice served under subsection (1), (2) or (3) is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be regarded as having been so served on the specified person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the copy is delivered personally—on the day on which the copy is so delivered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the copy is left at a place—on the day on which the copy is left at the place; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the copy is sent by post—on the second working day after the day on which the copy is posted.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作天) means any day other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public holiday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined in section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s30F
section.heading: Period while closure notices are in force

subsection.content: A closure notice comes into force on the date specified by the Authority in the closure notice under section 30D(2)(b)(iv).

subsection.leadIn: However, the date so specified must not be earlier than whichever is the later of the following dates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which a copy of the closure notice is served in accordance with section 30E;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which a copy of the closure notice is affixed at a conspicuous place on the subject premises under section 30D(3)(b).

subsection.content: A closure notice remains in force until it is cancelled under section 30N.

section.name: s30G
section.heading: Authority’s power to close subject premises
section.leadIn: During the period while a closure notice issued in respect of any subject premises is in force, the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lock or seal, or cause to be locked or sealed, the subject premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disconnect, or cause to be disconnected, all gas, water and electricity supplies to the subject premises.

section.name: s30H
section.heading: Prohibition on conducting specified process on subject premises

subsection.content: During the period while a closure notice issued in respect of any subject premises is in force, the specified person of the subject premises must ensure that no specified process described in the closure notice is conducted on the subject premises.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $50,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to establish that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the specified person had taken all reasonable precautions, and had exercised due diligence, to ensure that no such specified process was conducted on the subject premises.

subsection.leadIn: The person is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the defence under subsection (3) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s30I
section.heading: Prohibition on entering or remaining on subject premises

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3) and section 30J, during the period while a closure notice issued in respect of any subject premises is in force, a person must not enter or remain on the subject premises.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $20,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a public officer who enters or remains on the subject premises in good faith in the course of the public officer’s duty.

section.name: s30J
section.heading: Authority may permit people to enter or remain on subject premises

subsection.content: The Authority may, in writing, permit any person to enter or remain on any subject premises.

subsection.leadIn: In granting a permission under subsection (1), the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify in the permission the purpose for which the person is permitted to enter or remain on the subject premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may impose any condition that the Authority considers appropriate on the permission.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may revoke a permission if the Authority has reasonable cause to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purpose specified under subsection (2)(a) in the permission no longer exists; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition imposed under subsection (2)(b) on the permission has been breached.

section.name: s30K
section.heading: Prohibition on removing, defacing or interfering with closure notices

subsection.content: During the period while a closure notice issued in respect of any subject premises is in force, a person must not remove, deface or otherwise interfere with any copy of the closure notice affixed at a place under section 30D(3)(b).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s30L
section.heading: Prohibition on breaking or interfering with lock or seal attached to subject premises

subsection.content: During the period while a closure notice issued in respect of any subject premises is in force, a person must not break or otherwise interfere with any lock or seal attached to any part of the subject premises under section 30G(a).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s30M
section.heading: Defence for contravention of section 30I, 30K or 30L

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 30I, 30K or 30L to establish that the person had a reasonable excuse for the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: The person is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the defence under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.content: The specified person of, or any person having an interest in, any subject premises may apply in writing to the Authority for the cancellation of a closure notice issued in respect of the subject premises.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on an application made under subsection (1), cancel a closure notice if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the chimney, relevant plant, machinery or equipment used for the conduct of the specified process on the subject premises has been removed from the subject premises; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the subject premises have been abandoned and no specified process is being conducted on the subject premises.

subsection.content: The Authority may, on the Authority’s own initiative, cancel a closure notice if satisfied that the subject premises have been abandoned and no specified process is being conducted on the subject premises.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority refuses to cancel a closure notice on an application made under subsection (1), the Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a notice of refusal on the applicant as soon as reasonably practicable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the reasons for refusal in the notice.

section.name: s31
section.heading: When appeal may be brought; and effect thereof

subsection.leadIn: A person may appeal to the Appeal Board if he is aggrieved by a decision, requirement or specification of a public officer under any of the following provisions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 10(1) (requiring the abatement of air pollution); (Replaced 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 15(1) (refusing to grant a licence);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 15(4) (fixing terms and conditions of licence);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 16(4) (refusing to renew a licence);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 17(1)(a) (imposing new or amended terms or conditions for continuance of a licence);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 17(1)(b) (cancelling a licence);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: section 17(1)(c) (revoking, amending or adding to a notice or substituting a new notice);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: section 18(4) (refusing to vary a licence);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: section 18(7) (fixing terms and conditions for variation of a licence);

paragraph.name: ja
paragraph.content: section 18A(5) (refusing to transfer a licence); (Added 23 of 1987 s. 13)

paragraph.name: jb
paragraph.content: section 18A(8) (fixing terms and conditions on transfer of a licence); (Added 23 of 1987 s. 13)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: section 22(1)(a)(i) (imposing terms and conditions subject to which an exemption may continue in force);

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: section 22(1)(a)(iii) or 22(1)(b) (cancelling an exemption);

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: section 22(1)(c) (amending or adding to a notice or substituting a new notice);

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: section 23(4) (refusing to vary or cancel terms or conditions subject to which an exemption may continue in force);

paragraph.name: na
paragraph.content: section 26K(1) (refusing to increase a quantity of allocated allowances upon occurrence of a special event or failure to acquire emission credits); (Added 31 of 2008 s. 8)

paragraph.name: nb
paragraph.content: section 26M(4)(a) (refusing to grant an approval for the purposes of section 26M(2)); (Added 31 of 2008 s. 8)

paragraph.name: nc
paragraph.content: section 26M(7) (imposing terms and conditions upon granting an approval for the purposes of section 26M(2)); (Added 31 of 2008 s. 8)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: section 27 (requiring information to be furnished);

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: section 30(1)(i) (requiring the modification, replacing, cleaning or repair of or other steps to be taken relating to, a chimney, relevant plant or other machinery or equipment); (Amended 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: pa
paragraph.content: section 30(1)(ii) (requiring the installation of control equipment or systems); (Added 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: pb
paragraph.content: section 30(1)(iii) (requiring the operation of a chimney, relevant plant or other machinery or equipment in a specified manner); (Added 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: section 30(1)(iv) (prohibiting the use of specified fuels or other materials); (Amended 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: qa
paragraph.content: section 30D(1) (issuing a closure notice); (Added 5 of 2025 s. 5)

paragraph.name: qb
paragraph.content: section 30N(4) (refusing to cancel a closure notice); (Added 5 of 2025 s. 5)

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: section 40 (refusing to withhold information from public notification or other public access); (Amended 23 of 1987 s. 13)

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: any regulations made under section 43;

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: section 58 (refusal to enter or deferral of entry of an applicant’s name in the relevant register); (Added 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: section 67 (ordering the suspension or removal of registered asbestos persons from the relevant register); (Added 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: section 72 (requiring the owner to comply with conditions set by the Authority in an asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan); (Added 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: section 79 (requiring the owner to comply with requirements set by the Authority in an asbestos abatement notice). (Added 13 of 1993 s. 23)

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2A) and (2B), an appeal under subsection (1) is to be made by lodging notice of appeal in the prescribed manner and form within 21 days after the person aggrieved has received notice of the decision, requirement or specification. (Amended 5 of 2025 s. 5)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: An appeal against a decision under section 30D(1) to issue a closure notice is to be made by lodging a notice of appeal in the prescribed manner and form within 21 days after the day on which the closure notice comes into force under section 30F. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 5)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: An appeal against a decision under section 30N(4) to refuse to cancel a closure notice is to be made by lodging a notice of appeal in the prescribed manner and form within 21 days after the day on which the notice of refusal is served under section 30N(4)(a). (Added 5 of 2025 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: Where the decision, requirement or specification appealed from was made under a provision mentioned in paragraphs (a) or (e) to (j) or (jb) to (m) or (o) to (q) or (v) of subsection (1) the notice thereof shall be suspended from the day on which notice of appeal is duly given to the Authority and until the appeal is disposed of, withdrawn or abandoned, unless— (Amended 23 of 1987 s. 13; 13 of 1993 s. 23)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision, requirement or specification is considered by the Authority to be necessary because the continuation of the activities, whether licensed or otherwise, to which the notice relates would be, or be likely to be, prejudicial to health; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice contains a declaration to that effect.

subsection.content: No appeal shall lie under this section where the requirement of the Authority is made with the prior approval of the Chief Executive in Council under section 17(2) or 22(2). (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board shall refuse to determine an appeal under this section unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a decision, requirement or specification—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is not justified under this Ordinance or a technical memorandum issued under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has some material error in content or material defect in administrative procedure;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the opinion of the Authority or the authorized officer under section 10(2)(b) or (c) that the air pollution is prejudicial to health is unreasonable; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a disciplinary order or order for costs issued under section 67 against a registered asbestos consultant, supervisor, contractor or laboratory is unjustifiable. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 23)

subsection.content: Every appeal under section 31 shall be determined by an Appeal Board constituted under this Part.
The Chief Executive shall appoint as Chairman of Appeal Boards a person who is qualified in law and who is not a public officer. (Amended 31 of 2008 s. 9; 21 of 2024 s. 78)
Subject to section 34(3), the Chairman shall be appointed for a term of 3 years but may be re-appointed. (Amended 13 of 1993 s. 24)

The Chief Executive shall also appoint a panel of persons, not being public officers, whom he considers to be suitable for appointment as members of an Appeal Board pursuant to section 33(1). (Amended 31 of 2008 s. 9; 21 of 2024 s. 78)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: A member of the panel shall be appointed for a term of 3 years but may be reappointed. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 24)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.content: A member of the panel may resign by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 24. Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)
An appointment under subsection (2) and every appointment to the panel under subsection (4) shall be notified in the Gazette.

subsection.def: In subsection (2) and in section 34(1) qualified in law (具法律專業資格) means qualified for appointment as a District Judge under section 5 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).
In subsection (2), public officer (公職人員) does not include a judge or District Judge. (Added 31 of 2008 s. 9)

subsection.content: The jurisdiction of an Appeal Board on any appeal or group of appeals shall be exercised by the Chairman and such number of persons from the panel referred to in section 32(4) as the Chairman may appoint for that appeal or group of appeals.
On any appeal an Appeal Board may confirm, reverse or vary the decision, requirement or specification appealed from.

Every question before an Appeal Board shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of the Chairman and the members hearing the appeal except a question of law which shall be determined by the Chairman; in the event of an equality of votes the Chairman shall have a casting vote.

subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing summon any person to appear before it to produce any document or to give evidence that may reasonably be required.

subsection.content: In hearing an appeal, the Appeal Board may make an award for the costs involved in the appeal that is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case, and for an appeal described in subsection (6A), for compensation that is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case, including the conduct and comparative blameworthiness of the appellant and the appellant’s servants and agents, and of the public officers and any other persons concerned. (Replaced 13 of 1993 s. 25. Amended 5 of 2025 s. 6)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: The appeal mentioned in subsection (6) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appeal under section 31(1)(a) or (w), where the appellant was required to cease operations in order to comply with an abatement notice, pending the hearing of the appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an appeal under section 31(1)(qa) or (qb), where the subject premises as defined by section 30C were locked or sealed, pending the hearing of the appeal, because of the decision to issue a closure notice or to refuse to cancel a closure notice. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 6)

subsection.content: The Appeal Board shall have the powers which are vested in the Court of First Instance in the exercise of its powers under subsection (5)(a) or (c). (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)
The Chairman may determine any form or matter of practice or procedure in so far as no provision is made therefor by or under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on being summoned as a witness before the Appeal Board fails to attend;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attending as a witness refuses to be sworn or to produce a document or to answer a question as the Appeal Board may legally require of him; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: does any other thing which would, if the Appeal Board had been a court of law with power to commit for contempt, have been contempt of that court,

subsection.continued: the Chairman may certify under his hand the act of the person as contempt and the Court of First Instance may inquire into the alleged contempt. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 25. Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: After hearing any witnesses who may give evidence against or on behalf of the person charged with contempt, the Court of First Instance may punish the person as if he had been guilty of contempt of the Court of First Instance. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 25. Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

A witness before the Appeal Board is entitled to the same immunities and privileges as if he were a witness in civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 25. Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)
A sum awarded as costs or compensation on an appeal is enforceable as a civil debt and costs payable by the Authority on an appeal are a charge on the general revenue. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 25)

section.name: s34
section.heading: Supplementary provisions as to Appeal Board

subsection.content: If the Chairman is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from exercising his functions the Chief Executive may appoint any other person who is qualified in law and who is not a public officer to act as Chairman and as such to exercise and perform all of the functions, duties and powers of the Chairman during the period of his appointment. (Amended 31 of 2008 s. 11; 21 of 2024 s. 78)

If a person appointed by the Chairman under section 33(1) to hear an appeal or group of appeals is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong, or any other cause from exercising his functions, the Chairman may appoint any other person from the panel provided for in section 32(4) to act in his place.
The Chairman may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

content.leadIn: The hearing of an appeal may be continued notwithstanding any change in the membership of an Appeal Board as if the change had not occurred:
content.proviso: Provided that no person shall be appointed as a member of an Appeal Board before which the hearing of an appeal has been commenced without the consent of the parties.

subsection.def: In subsection (1), public officer (公職人員) does not include a judge or District Judge. (Added 31 of 2008 s. 11)

subsection.content: The Chairman may of his own motion, before an appeal is determined, refer any question of law to the Court of Appeal by way of case stated.
On the hearing of the case the Court of Appeal may amend the case or order it to be sent back to the Appeal Board for amendment.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of encouraging reduction and the better control of air pollution, the Secretary may, after consultation with the Advisory Council on the Environment, issue general advice in the form of Codes of Practice or give particular advice in writing to a person— (Amended L.N. 57 of 1994)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: operating or maintaining a chimney, relevant plant, machinery or equipment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conducting a specified process;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: operating, maintaining, repairing, modifying or adapting a motor vehicle;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: engaging in any asbestos related activities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: engaging in any other polluting process,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the construction, operation and maintenance of a chimney, relevant plant, machinery, equipment or containment;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the conduct of a process or activity or the carrying out of any work;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the storage, transportation, distribution, handling or use of materials;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the preparation of asbestos investigation reports, asbestos management plans and asbestos abatement plans; and

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: the maintenance and manner of using motor vehicles. (Replaced 13 of 1993 s. 26)

subsection.content: Failure on the part of any person to observe the provisions of any such Code or to accept any such advice shall not of itself render that person liable to criminal proceedings of any kind, but any such failure may, in any proceedings whether civil or criminal and including proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, be relied upon by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or to negative any liability which is in question in those proceedings.

section.name: s37A
section.heading: Technical memorandum
section.content: If the Secretary issues a technical memorandum under this Ordinance, he shall make available a copy of the technical memorandum for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government that the Secretary directs during business hours.

section.name: s37B
section.heading: Placing of technical memorandum before Legislative Council

subsection.content: The Secretary shall publish a technical memorandum issued under this Ordinance in the Gazette and shall cause it to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council at the next sitting after publication.

Where the Secretary has caused a technical memorandum to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council, the Legislative Council may, by resolution passed at a sitting of the Legislative Council held before the expiration of a period of 28 days after the sitting at which it was so laid, provide that the technical memorandum be amended in any manner consistent with the power to issue the technical memorandum.

subsection.leadIn: If the period for passing a resolution would, but for this subsection, expire—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after the end of a session of the Legislative Council or after a dissolution of the Legislative Council; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or before the day of the second sitting of the Legislative Council in the next following session of the Legislative Council,

subsection.continued: the period shall be deemed to extend to and expire on the day after that second sitting.

subsection.leadIn: Before the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (2) or that period as extended by virtue of subsection (3), the Legislative Council may by resolution in relation to a technical memorandum specified therein—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case where the period referred to in subsection (2) has been extended by virtue of subsection (3), extend that period as so extended to the first sitting of the Legislative Council held not earlier than the twenty-first day after the day of the second sitting in that next following session. (Replaced 8 of 2002 s. 9)

subsection.content: A resolution passed by the Legislative Council under this section shall be published in the Gazette not later than 14 days after the resolution is passed or within such further period as the Secretary may allow in any particular case.
A technical memorandum published under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.def: In this section, sitting (立法會會議), when used to calculate time, means the day on which the sitting commences and only includes a sitting at which subsidiary legislation is included on the order paper. (Added 89 of 1993 s. 34. Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

section.name: s37C
section.heading: Commencement of technical memorandum
section.leadIn: A technical memorandum shall commence to have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Legislative Council does not pass a resolution amending the technical memorandum, upon the expiry of the period or, the period as extended, as the case may be, for passing an amending resolution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Legislative Council passes a resolution amending the technical memorandum, at the beginning of the day of the publication in the Gazette of the resolution.

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedules 2A, 2B and 2C.

subsection.leadIn: Any fee prescribed in Schedule 2B—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be fixed at levels that provide for the recovery of the expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred in relation generally to the administration, regulation and control of the emission of specified pollutants that may take place or is likely to take place as a result of increases in the quantity of allocated allowances under section 26K; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in the provision of any particular service, facility or matter.

subsection.content: The Secretary may, after consultation with the Advisory Council on the Environment, amend any air quality objective by amending Schedule 5 by notice published in the Gazette. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 7)

Where on an application under section 14, 16, 18 or 18A, any objection to the grant of the application is duly made to the Authority, he may hear the applicant and any objector if he considers it expedient for the purpose of obtaining information relevant to any question to be decided. (Amended 23 of 1987 s. 14)
The procedure to be followed at, or for the purpose of convening, any hearing under subsection (1) shall be determined by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall cause to be kept, in such form as the Secretary may determine, a register containing details of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: applications required to be entered under section 14(3)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars and information contained in notices given to the Authority pursuant to section 19(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all exemptions under section 20;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: all licences;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other matters as may be required by regulations made under section 43 to be recorded in the register.

subsection.content: Upon application in writing to the Authority, the register shall be open for inspection by the public during normal office hours at such places as the Secretary thinks fit.
A person shall be entitled, upon payment of the prescribed fee, to a copy of any entry in the register certified by or on behalf of the Authority.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Protection of private information from publicity

subsection.content: Any person may apply to the Secretary to withhold from public notification or other public access under this Ordinance any information concerning a specified process, whether appearing in a licence or an application therefor or in any notice, return or other document.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Any person may apply to the Secretary to withhold from public notification or other public access under this Ordinance any information relating to the design, construction, modification or adaptation of any motor vehicle, fuel pump, equipment used for the storage of fuel or other similar apparatus or any petrol delivery vehicle, whether appearing in a licence or an application or in any notice, return, drawing, record or other document, if the release of that information would otherwise reveal to a competitor of that person vehicle designs, manufacturing techniques or strategy or other details of a confidential nature known only to the applicant, his employees or his professional advisers or consultants. (Added 2 of 1991 s. 8. Amended 19 of 1994 s. 10)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Any person may apply to the Secretary to withhold from public notification or other public access under this Ordinance any information concerning measures taken to prevent air pollution caused or contributed to by emissions from motor vehicles, whether appearing in a licence or an application or in any notice, return, drawing, record or other document, if the release of that information would otherwise reveal to a competitor of that person vehicle designs, manufacturing techniques or strategy or other details of a confidential nature known only to the applicant, his employees or his professional advisers or consultants. (Added 2 of 1991 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1), (1A) or (1B) shall be granted by the Secretary to the extent that he is satisfied that public notification or other public access to the information would— (Amended 2 of 1991 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be contrary to the applicant’s private interest to an unreasonable degree; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be contrary to the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: Where an application under this section is refused by the Secretary, whether in whole or in part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notice of the refusal and of the reasons therefor shall be given in writing by the Secretary to the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information shall not be publicly notified or otherwise made accessible to the public until the time for appeal under section 31(2) has expired, or, if notice of appeal is lodged before that time, until determination or withdrawal of the appeal.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Offence to disclose secret information obtained officially

subsection.content: A person commits an offence who, except in the circumstances provided for in subsection (2), discloses or gives to another person any information or document concerning a trade, business or manufactory secret which has come to his knowledge or into his possession in the course of the exercise or performance of his powers, functions or duties under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person does not commit an offence under subsection (1) if he discloses or gives any information or document to another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of the exercise or performance of his functions, duties or powers under this Ordinance or proceedings connected therewith;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pursuant to an order of a court under subsection (3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: with the consent in writing of all such persons as appear to him, after reasonable inquiry, to be interested in the confidentiality of the information or document.

subsection.content: Where in any proceedings a court considers that the justice of the case so requires, the court may order the disclosure of any information or the giving of any document referred to in subsection (1).
Any person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 4 of 2021)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Protection of Government and public officers

subsection.content: No liability shall rest on the Government or upon any public officer by reason of the fact that any licence is granted, renewed, varied, transferred or cancelled, or that any exemption is granted, continued or cancelled, under this Ordinance. (Amended 31 of 2008 s. 14)

A public officer shall not be personally liable in respect of any act or omission of his if it was done or made by him in the honest belief that it was required or authorized in the exercise of any function, duty or power of his under this Ordinance.
The protection conferred on public officers by subsection (2) in respect of any act or omission shall not in any way affect any liability of the Government in tort for that act or omission.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designation of noxious or offensive emissions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the abatement, prohibition and control of the emission into the atmosphere of air pollutants;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
f
g
paragraph.content: the court to make orders prohibiting the continuation of an activity that may evolve an air pollutant or the use of a chimney or relevant plant installed, altered, modified or operated in contravention of this Ordinance or requiring the chimney or relevant plant to be dismantled; (Replaced 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.content: the employment of competent persons to be in charge of a polluting process, or class of chimney, relevant plant or regulated activity;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the prohibition or restriction of the burning in or at any place whatsoever of any kind of material that may evolve air pollutants;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: the prohibition or control of any process or procedure used in or in connection with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a polluting process, or class of chimney, relevant plant or regulated activity; or (Replaced 13 of 1993 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conduct of any specified process, or any class thereof;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: in relation to any specified process, or any class thereof, the installation and use or operation of any specified type of equipment;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: any matters required to implement the provisions of Part IV relating to licences or exemptions;

paragraph.name: ma
paragraph.content: the time when an annual charge prescribed for the purposes of section 15A or 26A is to be paid, the recovery of such charge (if not paid) as a civil debt, the waiver or refund of such charge and for other matters relating to such charge; (Added 23 of 1987 s. 15)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: the particulars and information to be contained in a register;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: the imposition of requirements as to the composition, concentration, quantity, quality, viscosity or density and the use of any kind of fuel or any kind of other material that may evolve air pollutants; (Replaced 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: oa
paragraph.content: the prohibition, restriction or control of the production, treatment, distribution, import, storage, sale or use of any fuel, or any kind of other material that may evolve air pollutants and which is for use in Hong Kong; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28. Amended 19 of 1994 s. 11)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: the specification of the kinds of fuel, or any kind of other material that may evolve air pollutants (including fuel or other material used in the propulsion of any vessel, motor vehicle, railway locomotive or aircraft), and the kinds of relevant plant (including any furnace or engine used in the propulsion of any vessel, motor vehicle, railway locomotive or aircraft) to which the regulations are to apply;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: the making of orders prohibiting the use of any particular fuel, or any kind of other material that may evolve air pollutants, or class or mixture of fuels, or such other materials, in any relevant plant or an activity that may evolve air pollution;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: the application of standards (including vehicle design standards), specifications, descriptions, methods, procedures, requirements or tests laid down in documents (whether or not published or produced in Hong Kong) not forming part of the regulations and relating to the prevention or reduction of the emission of air pollutants including the application of such standards, specifications, descriptions, methods, procedures, requirements or tests in relation to the prohibition or control of the emission of air pollutants from motor vehicles; (Replaced 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: ra
paragraph.content: the inspection, examination, measurement or testing of motor vehicles and motor vehicle engines in relation to the prohibition or control of the emission of air pollutants therefrom and the fuels used or intended to be used therein, and the methods, equipment and procedures to be used or followed for such inspection, examination, measurement or testing; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: rb
paragraph.content: the fitting or installation of any apparatus or device to motor vehicles to prevent or reduce the emission of air pollutants therefrom; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: rc
paragraph.content: the prohibition or control of any material, lubricants or liquids that may evolve air pollutants if added to any fuel; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: rd
paragraph.content: the prohibition or control of the removal, replacement, modification, adaptation or alteration of any apparatus or device fitted to or installed in any motor vehicle or motor vehicle engine and so fitted or installed to prevent or reduce the emission of air pollutants therefrom; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: re
paragraph.content: the prohibition or control of the use of any motor vehicle modified, adapted, altered, maintained or operated in contravention of any requirement imposed under this Ordinance; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: rf
paragraph.content: the prohibition or control of the removal, replacement, modification, adaptation or alteration of any motor vehicle or motor vehicle engine that has the effect or intended effect of increasing the emission of air pollutants therefrom; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: rg
paragraph.content: the imposition of requirements as to the design, construction, maintenance, adjustment, repair or operation of any motor vehicle or motor vehicle engine in order to prevent or reduce the emission of air pollutants therefrom; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: rh
paragraph.content: the prohibition or control of the modification, adaptation or alteration of any fuel pump or other equipment and fittings used for or in connection with the dispensing of fuel, and the prohibition or control of the removal, alteration or defacement of any information required to be displayed in respect of such fuel pump or other equipment and fittings; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9. Amended 19 of 1994 s. 11)

paragraph.name: ri
paragraph.content: the prohibition or control of the use of any fuel pump or other equipment and fittings used for or in connection with the dispensing of fuel modified, adapted, altered or operated in contravention of this Ordinance; (Added 2 of 1991 s. 9. Amended 19 of 1994 s. 11)

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: the keeping of records and statistics relating to the emission of air pollutants from any chimney, relevant plant, an activity that may evolve air pollution, or the composition, concentration, quantity, quality or density of fuel, or any kind of other material that may evolve air pollutants, used in any relevant plant, an activity that may evolve air pollution, or any class of relevant plant or regulated activity;

paragraph.name: sa
paragraph.content: the imposition of requirements on the handling, transportation or storage of a substance or thing which may evolve an air pollutant; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: sb
paragraph.content: the forfeiture of a substance or thing which may evolve an air pollutant and which is not handled, transported or stored in accordance with this Ordinance; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: the manner of determining the amount of compensation payable under sections 24 and 25, the factors to be taken into account or disregarded and the principles to be applied in determining that amount;

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: the information to be included in forms to be used and the procedure to be followed for the purposes of appeals under Part VI;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: authorizing the Authority to confer exemptions from any provisions of the regulations;

paragraph.name: x
xa
xb
paragraph.content: the duties and liabilities of a person, company or laboratory registered under provisions relating to the control of air pollution from asbestos; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: xc
paragraph.content: the practices, standards, procedures and guide-lines to follow for a person, company or laboratory registered under provisions relating to the control of air pollution from asbestos; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: xd
paragraph.content: the labelling and manner of labelling of a substance or object known to contain asbestos; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: xe
paragraph.content: the investigation for asbestos in premises or a ship in Hong Kong before, or during, repair, maintenance or demolition work is carried out, the preparation of an asbestos investigation report, the preparation and implementation of an asbestos management plan and the implementation of an asbestos abatement work at specified places by registered asbestos consultants, supervisors, contractors and laboratories, with conditions that may be considered necessary; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: xf
paragraph.content: the registration of premises or a dock as a specified place for the purpose of a regulation made under paragraph (xe) subject to conditions that the Secretary may consider reasonably necessary; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: xg
paragraph.content: the application of Part IX (which deals with asbestos control work) to the extent that the Secretary considers necessary to ships and docks used for the repair and breaking of ships; (Added 13 of 1993 s. 28)

paragraph.name: y
paragraph.content: unless otherwise provided prescribing anything which under this Ordinance is to be or may be prescribed;

paragraph.name: z
paragraph.content: the better carrying out generally of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section may be of general application or limited to any particular air control zone or other area or district or to any polluting process or specified process, or any class or kind thereof or to any particular motor vehicle, or any type, class or kind thereof, or to any particular motor vehicle engine, or any type, class or kind thereof. (Amended 2 of 1991 s. 9)

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), where fuel, or other material, is subject to the requirements as to composition, concentration, quantity, quality, viscosity or density imposed by regulations under this section, the regulations may, in order that persons to whom the fuel, or other material, is supplied are afforded information as to its composition, concentration, quantity, quality, viscosity or density, impose requirements for securing that the information is displayed at such places and in such manner as may be prescribed.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this section may provide that a contravention of specified provisions thereof or of specified conditions of a licence shall be an offence and may provide penalties therefor not exceeding a fine of $200,000 and imprisonment for 6 months, and in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine not exceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: $1,000 in respect of every one quarter of an hour; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: $50,000 in respect of each day,

subsection.continued: during the whole or any part of which the offence continues, as the circumstances may require. (Amended 23 of 1987 s. 15)

subsection.content: Subject to this section, this Ordinance shall bind the Government.

Section 10, 12 or 13 shall not have effect to permit proceedings to be taken against, or to impose any criminal liability on, the Government or on any person who causes or permits to be emitted any air pollutant or conducts any specified process which he is required to emit or conduct in the course of carrying out his duties in the service of the Government.

If it appears to the Authority that any emission of an air pollutant or conduct of a specified process is being, or has been, emitted or conducted in contravention of section 10, 12 or 13, by any person in the course of carrying out his duties in the service of the Government, the Authority shall, if the contravention is not forthwith terminated to his satisfaction, report the matter to the Chief Secretary for Administration. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

On receipt of a report under subsection (3) the Chief Secretary for Administration shall enquire into the circumstances and, if his enquiry shows that a contravention of section 10, 12 or 13 is continuing or likely to recur, he shall ensure that the best practicable steps are taken to terminate the contravention or avoid the recurrence. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

Any notice or application under this Ordinance concerning the emission of an air pollutant or the conduct of a specified process which is to be, or may be, given or made by or on behalf of the Government may be given or made by any public officer on behalf of the Government.

Any notice under this Ordinance concerning the emission of an air pollutant or the conduct of a specified process which is to be, or may be, given by the Authority to the Government shall be given to the principal officer of the Government Department which appears to the Authority to be responsible for the emission or conduct or, in the event of any question arising as to which Department is responsible, to such public officer as the Chief Secretary for Administration shall determine. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)
No fee or charge prescribed for the purposes of this Ordinance shall be payable by the Government.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Advisory Council on the Environment
section.content: If any question arises as to who are the body of persons for the time being constituting the Advisory Council on the Environment mentioned in sections 6, 7A, 37 and 43 the matter shall be referred to the Chief Secretary for Administration, who shall determine the question by certificate under his hand.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Limit of time for laying informations, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A complaint or information in respect of an offence other than an indictable offence under this Ordinance may only be made or laid, as the case may be, within— (Amended 13 of 1993 s. 29; 5 of 2025 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 6 months from the time when the matter of such complaint or information respectively first came to the knowledge of the Authority or an authorized officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 year from the time of the commission of the offence,

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to the making of a complaint or laying of an information for an offence which is a continuing offence. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 29)

Where an offence is of a continuing nature a complaint or information in respect of the offence shall be made or laid, as the case may be, within 6 months after the continuance of the offence first coming to the notice of the Authority or an authorized officer. (Added 13 of 1993 s. 29)

Subject to this section, prosecutions for offences against this Ordinance may be brought in the name of the Authority, and may be commenced and conducted by any public officer appointed under section 13 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227).
Nothing in this section shall be deemed to derogate from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in relation to the prosecution of offences. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

section.name: s47A
section.heading: Directors of body corporate liable in certain circumstances

subsection.content: Where a person convicted of an offence under this Ordinance is a body corporate and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of, a director, manager, secretary or other person concerned in the management of the body corporate, the director, manager, secretary or other person also commits the offence.

Where a person convicted of an offence under this Ordinance is a partner in a partnership and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of, any other partner or any person concerned in the management of the partnership, the partner or the person concerned in the management also commits the offence.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Defences in proceedings relating to emission of air pollutants
section.leadIn: In any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance relating to the emission of an air pollutant it shall be a defence to prove the contravention complained of was—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: solely due to the lighting up of a relevant plant which was cold and that the best practicable means had been taken to prevent or minimise the emission of the air pollutant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: solely due to some failure of a chimney or relevant plant or of an apparatus used in connection with a chimney or relevant plant and that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the failure could not have reasonably been foreseen, or if foreseen, could not reasonably have been provided against;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the contravention could not reasonably have been prevented by action taken after the failure occurred; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: as soon as was reasonably practicable after the occurrence of the failure the Authority was informed thereof in writing.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), this section applies in relation to the proceedings for an offence under section 10(7), 12(2), 13(2), 20AA(3), 30A, 69(9), 73(2) or 79(7).

subsection.leadIn: In those proceedings, it is a defence for a person charged with an offence mentioned in subsection (1) to establish that the commission of the offence was for any or all of the following purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prevention of injury to, or the saving of the life of, any person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the prevention of damage to any property in an emergency situation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prevention of a serious interruption or disruption to any public transport systems or public utilities in an emergency situation.

subsection.leadIn: The person is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the defence under subsection (2) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.content: If a person commits an offence mentioned in subsection (1) before the date on which this section comes into operation*, this section does not apply in relation to the proceedings for the offence brought against the person.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Provisions of Ordinance to be in addition to any other Ordinance
section.content: The provisions of this Ordinance shall be in addition to and not in lieu of the provisions of any other Ordinance.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Service of notices
section.leadIn: The Authority may serve a notice to be served on a person under this Ordinance (except section 30D)— (Amended 5 of 2025 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by serving a copy personally or by registered post addressed to the last known place of business or residence of the person to be served; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the notice is to be served on the owner of any premises or a ship, by fixing a copy on a conspicuous part of the premises or ship.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall keep registers of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: asbestos consultants for natural persons who are qualified to perform the duties and functions of a registered asbestos consultant;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: asbestos supervisors for natural persons who are qualified to perform the duties and functions of a registered asbestos supervisor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: asbestos laboratories for all laboratories which are qualified to perform the duties and functions of a registered asbestos laboratory together with details of the natural persons, companies and other bodies corporate that have an interest in a registered asbestos laboratory.

subsection.content: The Authority shall maintain a copy of the registers for inspection by the public free of charge during business hours.
The Authority shall appoint an Administration Committee to be known as the Asbestos Administration Committee.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Administration Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed for 2 years or a lesser period that may be specified in the terms of his appointment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may resign by giving notice in writing to the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may be reappointed.

subsection.content: Where a member of the Administration Committee is precluded by temporary absence or incapacity from carrying out his functions as a member, the Authority may appoint another person, with similar qualifications as set out in section 54 as the precluded member, to hold office in the place of the member during the period of absence or incapacity.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assist the Authority in processing applications for entry in the registers as set out in this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hear complaints of a disciplinary nature against persons whose names are on any of the registers and make recommendations that it sees fit in accordance with this Part; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: carry out other functions and duties of the Authority relating to asbestos, its use and disposal that the Authority may delegate in writing to it.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Composition and meeting of the Administration Committee

subsection.leadIn: The Administration Committee shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an Assistant Director of Environmental Protection as Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Principal Environmental Protection Officer of the Environmental Protection Department;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a representative of the Commissioner for Labour;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a representative of the Director of Housing;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a representative of the Director of Architectural Services;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an architect nominated by The Hong Kong Institute of Architects;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an engineer nominated by The Hong Kong Institution of Engineers;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a surveyor nominated by The Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 3 members appointed by the Authority who are not employed in the Civil Service.

subsection.content: A Senior Environmental Protection Officer of the Environmental Protection Department shall act as Secretary of the Administration Committee.
The Administration Committee shall meet at the times and places as the Authority may direct.

A person may apply to the Secretary of the Administration Committee to have his name entered in a register in a form approved by the Authority with the fee set by the Authority and published in the Gazette.

The Authority shall not enter the name of a person, company, body corporate or laboratory in a register unless the Authority is satisfied that the person is qualified to perform the duties and functions required of a person entered in the register.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Restriction on entry on certain registers, etc.

subsection.content: The Authority shall not enter the name of a registered asbestos consultant or of a registered asbestos laboratory on the register of asbestos contractors or the register of asbestos supervisors.
The Authority shall not enter the name of a registered asbestos contractor or of a registered asbestos supervisor on the register of asbestos consultants or the register of asbestos laboratories.

The Authority may refuse to register, or may remove from the relevant register, an asbestos consultant or an asbestos laboratory if the person or owner holds a pecuniary interest, either directly or indirectly, in a registered asbestos contractor or a registered asbestos supervisor.

The Authority may refuse to register, or may remove from the relevant register, an asbestos contractor or an asbestos supervisor if the person or owner holds a pecuniary interest, either directly or indirectly, in a registered asbestos consultant or a registered asbestos laboratory.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Function of Administration Committee in registration
section.leadIn: The Administration Committee shall assist the Authority in considering applications for inclusion in the registers by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: examining the qualifications of an applicant;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: conducting a professional interview, if the Administration Committee considers it necessary, with an applicant; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: advising the Authority as to the acceptance, deferral or rejection of an application for entry on the registers.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall, within 3 months after the receipt of advice from the Administration Committee as to the acceptance, deferral or rejection of an application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter in the appropriate register, the name of the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defer the application for a period not exceeding 12 months; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.content: The Authority shall inform an applicant of his decision and reasons for his decision in the case of a deferral or rejection under subsection (1) immediately after making the decision.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Annual registration fee
section.content: A registered person, company or laboratory shall pay the prescribed annual fee for continued registration within the prescribed period.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Removal of names from registers
section.leadIn: The Authority may remove from a register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of a person who is deceased;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of a person who, or a company, body corporate or laboratory which, in the opinion of the Authority has ceased to carry on relevant business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of a person who, or a company, body corporate or laboratory which, has not paid the prescribed annual fee within the prescribed period;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a name at the request of the person, company, body corporate or laboratory.

subsection.content: A person, company, body corporate or laboratory whose name has been removed from a register under section 60(c) may apply to the Authority in writing within 2 years from the date of the removal for restoration of the name to the register.
Subject to the payment of the prescribed fee to restore a name, the Authority shall restore the name to the register.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Disciplinary proceedings
section.leadIn: Where it appears to the Authority or a member of the Administration Committee that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered asbestos consultant, registered asbestos contractor, registered asbestos supervisor or registered asbestos laboratory; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director, partner or owner of a registered asbestos contractor or registered asbestos laboratory,

section.continued: has committed neglect or misconduct that—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: renders the person, company, body corporate or laboratory unfit to continue to be entered on the relevant register; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: makes further entry of the person, company, body corporate or laboratory on the relevant register prejudicial to the administration of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: renders the person, company, body corporate or laboratory deserving of censure,

section.continued: the Authority or the member may refer the matter to the Administration Committee which may conduct an inquiry.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Legal adviser
section.content: The Administration Committee may appoint a legal adviser to advise it on any points of law or procedure that may arise before, during or after a disciplinary inquiry.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Rules of procedure
section.content: The Administration Committee may make rules providing for the conduct of its inquiries and for other matters relating to the investigation of an alleged court conviction, neglect or misconduct.

subsection.content: The Administration Committee shall not hear evidence regarding a complaint leading to disciplinary proceedings against a registered person unless the person is given 28 days’ notice of the date, time and place of the hearing and the reason for the hearing.

The registered person who is the subject of a hearing, and the directors, partners and proprietors of a registered asbestos contractor or registered asbestos laboratory, are entitled to hear and to have access to all evidence produced at the hearing and to cross-examine witnesses adducing the evidence.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Finding and recommendation of Administration Committee

subsection.content: After an inquiry, the Administration Committee shall advise the Authority whether or not it is satisfied that the person, company, body corporate or laboratory has committed neglect or misconduct referred to in section 62 and, where appropriate, make a recommendation as to penalty that should be imposed.

The Authority shall advise the registered person, company, body corporate or laboratory of the findings and recommendation of the Administration Committee and the order of the Authority under section 67.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on receiving the recommendation of the Administration Committee, order—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the person, company, body corporate or laboratory be reprimanded;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that a shareholder, director or other officer of a company or body corporate be reprimanded;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the findings and order be published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The Authority may make an order as to the payment of the costs of the inquiry, the costs of the Authority and the costs of any person in respect of whom the inquiry is held.
Costs awarded under this section are recoverable as a civil debt.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of an inquiry under this Part, the Administration Committee has the following powers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to hear, receive and examine evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to summon a person to attend the inquiry either as the person whose conduct is the subject of the inquiry or to give evidence or produce any document or other thing in his possession and to examine him as a witness or require him to produce any document or other thing in his possession, subject to all lawful exceptions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to admit or exclude the public or any member of the public from the inquiry;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to admit or exclude the press from the inquiry;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to order the inspection of any premises or ship not used solely for dwelling purpose;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to enter upon and view any premises or ship not used solely for dwelling purpose;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to award any person summoned to attend the inquiry as a witness an amount which in the opinion of the Administration Committee has been reasonably expended by him in connection with his attendance.

subsection.content: The Chairman shall sign summonses to witnesses.
No person is required to answer a question or produce a document or other thing which, in the opinion of the Administration Committee, may tend to incriminate him.

A witness is, in respect of evidence given by him before the Administration Committee, entitled to the same immunities and privileges to which he would be entitled as if he were giving evidence in court.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: fraudulently obtains registration as a registered asbestos consultant, contractor, supervisor or laboratory for himself or any other person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: obtains registration as a registered asbestos consultant, contractor, supervisor or laboratory for himself or any other person by means of any misleading, false or fraudulent representation or statement, either orally or in writing,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.content: The owner of premises which contain or may reasonably be suspected of containing asbestos containing material shall engage a registered asbestos consultant to carry out an investigation on any asbestos containing material which may be in the premises and submit an asbestos investigation report in accordance with section 70 and, if asbestos containing material is found in the premises, an asbestos abatement plan in accordance with section 71 at least 28 days before he carries out any intended asbestos abatement work or work which involves the use or handling of any asbestos containing material.

An owner is not required to submit an asbestos investigation report or an asbestos abatement plan under subsection (1) if the asbestos abatement work or work involving the use or handling of asbestos containing material is of a class specified by the Secretary.
The Secretary shall publish notice in the Gazette of a class of work specified under subsection (2).

The owner of premises specified by the Authority shall, unless the premises have been certified in writing by the Director of Architectural Services or a public officer authorized by the Secretary as being free of asbestos containing material, engage a registered asbestos consultant to carry out an investigation on any asbestos containing material which may be present in the premises.

subsection.leadIn: If premises are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: converted to a use; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: constructed for a purpose,

subsection.continued: that would make them premises specified by the Authority under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the owner of the premises shall comply with; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the premises are deemed to be premises specified by the Authority under,

subsection.content: The Secretary shall publish notice of the specification of premises under subsection (4) in the Gazette.

The owner of premises specified under subsection (4) shall submit an asbestos investigation report in accordance with section 70 to the Authority before the date stated in the notice specifying the premises.

If the registered asbestos consultant finds the presence of asbestos containing material in premises specified under subsection (4), the owner of the premises shall submit to the Authority an asbestos management plan in accordance with section 71 and an asbestos investigation report both prepared by the registered asbestos consultant.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carries out work on premises contrary to subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to submit an asbestos investigation report contrary to subsection (7); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to submit an asbestos management plan contrary to subsection (8),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to a further fine of $5,000 for each day during the whole or part of which the court is satisfied that the offence has continued.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Contents of asbestos investigation report
section.leadIn: A registered asbestos consultant shall sign an asbestos investigation report on premises or a ship when required under this Ordinance and the report shall include details of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the identity of the owner of the premises or ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the location and type of the premises or ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the names of the registered asbestos consultant and registered asbestos laboratory carrying out the investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the methods adopted for the investigation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the results of the investigation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: an assessment of hazards of asbestos containing material in the premises or ship with particular reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the quantity, type and composition;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the friability;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the physical condition;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the accessibility;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the position in relation to the path of natural and artificial ventilation; and

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the population and activities in the immediate vicinity.

subsection.leadIn: A registered asbestos consultant shall sign an asbestos management plan when required under this Ordinance and the plan shall include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an operation and maintenance plan for asbestos containing material not requiring asbestos removal work; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an asbestos abatement plan for any asbestos abatement work or work which involves the use or handling of any asbestos containing material.

subsection.leadIn: The registered asbestos consultant shall include in the operation and maintenance plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a detailed description of the premises or ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the names, positions and structure of the organization of people in charge of the implementation of the plan;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the location and type of all the identified asbestos containing material;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the physical condition of the identified asbestos containing material;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a statement of reasons why any asbestos containing material should not be removed;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the method of labelling of all asbestos containing material;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the method of informing all people who may be affected about the existence and the location of the asbestos containing material;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a surveillance scheme;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a record keeping scheme;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the methods by which the disturbance of asbestos containing material can be avoided; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the actions to be taken in case the condition of the asbestos containing material is found to be deteriorating.
