subsection.leadIn: The registered asbestos consultant shall include in an asbestos abatement plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a detailed description of the premises or ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the names of the registered asbestos consultant, registered asbestos contractor, and registered asbestos laboratory;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement of reasons why any asbestos containing material should not be removed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a programme for asbestos abatement work;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: descriptions of methods, measures and steps for checking the performance of the asbestos control measures before, during and after the asbestos abatement work or work which involves the use or handling of asbestos containing material;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the amount of asbestos waste and the method of disposal; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any emergency procedures and contingency measures which may be required.

subsection.content: The Authority may, after receiving an asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan, require the owner of the premises or ship to submit further plans and specifications within the period specified by the Authority.

The Authority may, by notice in writing to the owner of premises or a ship, require additional measures or impose conditions as he considers necessary to be included in an asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan.

A person who is aggrieved by a requirement or specification of the Authority under subsection (1) may appeal, within 21 days after he has received notice of the requirement or specification, to an Appeal Board.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Notification of commencement of asbestos abatement work

subsection.content: The owner of premises shall give not less than 28 days’ written notice to the Authority of the date on which the asbestos abatement work or work involving the use or handling of asbestos containing material is to be commenced.
A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Appointment and duties of registered asbestos consultants

subsection.content: An owner of premises who implements an asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan in the premises shall appoint a registered asbestos consultant to supervise the carrying out of the work specified in the plan.

If a registered asbestos consultant so appointed becomes unwilling to act or unable to act, whether by reason of the termination of his appointment or for any other reason, the owner shall appoint another registered asbestos consultant and notify the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A registered asbestos consultant so appointed shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: supervise the carrying out of the asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan and the conduct of any asbestos abatement work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the Authority of any modification of the content of the asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan before implementing the modification; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: notify the Authority of any contravention of a requirement under this Ordinance or in respect of a step, measure, requirement and condition in an asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan, or required by the Authority.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Appointment and duties of registered asbestos contractors

subsection.content: An owner of premises who implements an asbestos abatement plan or carries out work which involves the use or handling of any asbestos containing material in the premises shall appoint a registered asbestos contractor to carry out the work.

If a registered asbestos contractor so appointed becomes unwilling to act or unable to act, whether by reason of the termination of his appointment or for any other reason, the owner shall appoint another registered asbestos contractor and shall notify the Authority.

A registered asbestos contractor appointed under this section shall give continuous supervision through registered asbestos supervisors stationed continuously at the asbestos abatement area to supervise the carrying out of the asbestos abatement plan, asbestos abatement work or work which involves the use or handling of any asbestos containing material and any related work.

An owner is not required to appoint a registered asbestos contractor to carry out any work which involves the use or handling of any asbestos containing material in premises if the work is of a class specified by the Secretary.
The Secretary shall publish notice in the Gazette of a class of work specified under subsection (4).

section.name: s76
section.heading: Appointment and duties of registered asbestos laboratories

subsection.content: An owner of premises who is required to carry out sampling, measurement or analysis of a substance containing, or suspected to contain, asbestos containing material in the premises to comply with an asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan or otherwise to comply with this Part, shall appoint a registered asbestos laboratory to carry out the sampling, measurement or analysis.

If a registered asbestos laboratory so appointed becomes unwilling to act or unable to act, whether by reason of the termination of its appointment or for any other reason, the owner shall appoint another registered asbestos laboratory and notify the Authority.
A person who implements or causes the implementation of an asbestos management plan or asbestos abatement plan contrary to section 74 commits an offence.

A person who implements or causes the implementation of an asbestos abatement plan or carries out or causes the carrying out of work involving the use or handling of asbestos containing material contrary to section 75 commits an offence.

A person who carries out or causes the carrying out of the sampling, measurement or analysis of a substance containing or suspected to contain asbestos containing material contrary to section 76 commits an offence.

A person who does not follow the specifications, steps or measures specified in an asbestos management plan or an asbestos abatement plan and any additional measures or steps stipulated by the Authority and any conditions imposed on the plan by the Authority commits an offence.

A person who is convicted of an offence under this section is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months and to a further fine of $20,000 for each day during the whole or part of which the court is satisfied that the offence has continued.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under section 77 in respect of any work in the premises or any part of the premises if the person establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person carried out the work, or caused or permitted the work to be carried out, in an emergency situation that did not permit the person to comply with that section without risk to human life, placing any property in danger of being damaged or serious disruption to a public service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person did not know and could not have reasonably known of the presence of asbestos containing material in the premises or that part of the premises at the time when the person carried out the work, or caused or permitted the work to be carried out.

subsection.leadIn: The person is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the defence if— (Amended 5 of 2025 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: If a person commits an offence under section 77 before the date on which section 11(1) and (2) of the Air Pollution Control (Amendment) Ordinance 2025 (5 of 2025) (specified provision) comes into operation* (commencement date)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subsections (1) and (2) as in force immediately before the commencement date continue to apply in relation to the proceedings for the offence brought against the person as if the specified provision had not been enacted. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: If in the opinion of the Authority, any premises, relevant plant or activity contains, or is believed may release, any asbestos, the Authority or an authorized officer may issue a notice either verbally or in writing to require the person to whom the notice is given to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take measures or steps and within the time as specified to prevent, control, reduce or eliminate the release of asbestos;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hire a registered asbestos consultant to prepare an investigation report and to prepare an asbestos management plan;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: hire a registered asbestos laboratory to carry out sampling and measurement to assess fibre concentration.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority or an authorized officer may by notice require the owner of premises to suspend immediately the operation of a relevant plant or activity until the Authority or the authorized officer is satisfied that sufficient measures have been taken to prevent the release of asbestos, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the premises or activity releases any visible asbestos containing material in any form of dust, debris, effluent or contaminated item; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any visible dust, debris, untreated effluent or contaminated item is observed to be originating from a containment in which asbestos abatement work or work involving the use of handling of asbestos containing material is being carried out; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the premises or activity causes or contributes to a concentration of asbestos of more than 0.01 fibres per millilitre in ambient air at any time as determined by a method approved by the Secretary.

subsection.content: The Secretary shall publish in the Gazette notice of any method of measurement approved by him under subsection (2)(c).
A notice issued under subsection (1) or (2) shall remain in force until it is withdrawn.
If a notice is given or withdrawn verbally, the Authority or an authorized officer shall confirm the notice or its withdrawal in writing within 7 days.

Where the relevant person cannot be found or fails to comply with a requirement in a notice issued under subsection (1) or (2), the Authority may carry out or cause to carry out a measure or step specified in the notice or other work as he considers necessary and the costs shall be recoverable from the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with any of the requirements of a notice given to him under subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case of failure to stop immediately the operation of any process as required, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months and to a further fine of $100,000 for each day that the court is satisfied that the offence has continued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, to a fine at level 6 on first conviction and to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months on a second or subsequent conviction and, on a first or subsequent conviction, to a further fine of $20,000 for each day that the court is satisfied that the offence has continued.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) to (7) shall apply to a ship.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Ban on Use, Supply, Import and Transhipment of Asbestos etc.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Ban on use, supply, import and transhipment of asbestos or asbestos containing material

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 82 and 83, a person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use, supply, import or tranship asbestos or asbestos containing material; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause or permit the use, supply, import or transhipment of asbestos or asbestos containing material.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1)(a) or (b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), if a person imported asbestos or asbestos containing material that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is consigned on a through bill of lading or a through air waybill from a place outside Hong Kong to another place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is or is to be removed from the vessel, vehicle or aircraft on which it was imported; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: is or is to be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: returned to the same vessel, vehicle or aircraft before being exported; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: transferred to another vessel, vehicle or aircraft before being exported,

subsection.continued: the person tranships the asbestos or asbestos containing material.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (3)(c), it does not matter whether the asbestos or asbestos containing material—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is or is to be directly transferred between those vessels, vehicles or aircrafts; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to be landed in Hong Kong after its importation and stored pending exportation.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: supply without consideration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offer or expose for supply;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sell, or offer or expose for sale; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: hire out, or offer or expose for hiring out;

def.name: Use
def.leadIn: use (使用), in relation to asbestos or asbestos containing material, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: affixing, applying, spraying or installing asbestos or asbestos containing material on or in any premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adding, mixing or inserting asbestos or asbestos containing material to, with, into any material, substance, product or article for manufacturing or producing any product or substance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: wrapping any material, substance, product or article with asbestos or asbestos containing material.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under section 80(2) for an article if the person establishes that at the time of the alleged offence the person did not know and could not have reasonably known that the article is asbestos or asbestos containing material.

subsection.leadIn: The person is taken to have established a fact that needs to be established for the defence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.content: Section 80 does not prohibit a person from importing or transhipping, or causing or permitting the import or transhipment of, asbestos or asbestos containing material that is goods in transit.
For subsection (1), it is presumed, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that the asbestos or asbestos containing material is not goods in transit.

subsection.leadIn: Section 80 does not prohibit a person from supplying, importing or transhipping, or causing or permitting the supply, import or transhipment of, asbestos containing material that is proprietary Chinese medicine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registered under section 121(2) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deemed under section 128(2) of that Ordinance to be registered; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: exempted under section 158(5) of that Ordinance from the application of section 119 of that Ordinance.

subsection.content: Section 80 does not prohibit an exempted person for a proprietary Chinese medicine from supplying or importing, or causing or permitting the supply or import of, asbestos containing material that is the proprietary Chinese medicine.
Section 80 does not prohibit a person from using asbestos or asbestos containing material in work carried out in an industrial undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: exempted person (豁免人士) means a person or an institution that is exempted under section 158(1) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549) from the application of section 119 of that Ordinance in relation to a proprietary Chinese medicine;

def.name: GoodsInTransit
def.leadIn: goods in transit (過境貨品) means goods that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are brought into Hong Kong solely for being taken out of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remain at all times on the vessel, vehicle or aircraft that brought the goods into Hong Kong;

subsection.def: industrial undertaking (工業經營) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59), but does not include an undertaking or agricultural operation to which that Ordinance does not apply under section 2(3) of that Ordinance;
proprietary Chinese medicine (中成藥) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549).

subsection.leadIn: On application, the Authority may exempt a person from a prohibition imposed under section 80(1) if the Authority considers that the exemption—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is warranted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: would be unlikely to lead to a health risk to the community.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose any condition subject to which the exemption is granted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may withdraw the exemption at any time.

subsection.content: If the person fails to comply with a condition of the exemption, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Seizure etc. of asbestos or asbestos containing material following conviction under section 80

subsection.leadIn: If a person is convicted of an offence under section 80(2), the Authority or an authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seize, remove, destroy or otherwise dispose of the asbestos or asbestos containing material connected with the offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice require the person to remove, destroy or otherwise dispose of the asbestos or asbestos containing material within the time and in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the person fails to comply with a requirement in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority or an authorized officer may, without further notice, seize, remove, destroy or otherwise dispose of the asbestos or asbestos containing material connected with the offence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is liable to the Government for any costs incurred under paragraph (b) (including the transportation and storage costs of the asbestos or asbestos containing material).

subsection.content: The costs under subsection (2)(c) are recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

paragraph.content: Acrylates Works

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made or purified;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made and polymerised; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: purified and polymerised.
Aluminium Works

td.leadIn: Works of the following kinds in which the processing capacity exceeds 1 tonne (expressed as aluminium) or, if the mode of operation is continuous, 0.67 tonne (expressed as aluminium) per hour, and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: aluminium swarf is degreased by the application of heat; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: aluminium or aluminium alloys are recovered from aluminium or aluminium alloy scrap fabricated metal, swarf, skimmings, or other residues by melting under flux cover; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: molten aluminium or aluminium alloys are treated by chlorine or its compounds; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: aluminium is extracted from any compound containing aluminium by a process evolving any noxious or offensive gases; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: oxide of aluminium is extracted from any ore; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: aluminium is recovered from slag or drosses; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: materials used in the above processes or the products thereof are treated or handled by methods which cause noxious or offensive gases to be evolved.
Cement Works

paragraph.leadIn: Works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in which—

subparagraph.content: cement is handled;
argillaceous and calcareous materials are used in the production of cement clinker; or
cement clinker is ground; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in which—

subparagraph.content: the total bulk storage capacity exceeds 50 tonnes;
the total installed capacity of concrete mixers exceeds 3m3; or
the total hourly concrete production rate exceeds 20m3 (expressed as volume of concrete) per hour.

paragraph.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(b)(i)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the total bulk storage capacity is the aggregate of the storage capacity of any fixed or mobile form of installed storage facilities (relevant installed storage facility) that are—

subparagraph.content: connected to (whether temporarily or permanently) any operational equipment involved in the operation of the works (relevant operational equipment); and
intended to be used for the storage of bulk cementitious materials;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a relevant installed storage facility may be—

subparagraph.content: a storage facility on land (including a storage facility on a mobile storage tanker connected to the relevant operational equipment); or
a storage facility on a ship or barge;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the total storage capacity of all storage facilities on a mobile storage tanker connected to the relevant operational equipment does not exceed 50 tonnes, that storage capacity may be excluded from the calculation of the total bulk storage capacity; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subparagraph (c), if the storage facilities on more than one mobile storage tanker are connected to the relevant operational equipment at the same time, the total storage capacity of the storage facilities on only 1 mobile storage tanker may be excluded from the calculation of the total bulk storage capacity.

For the purposes of paragraph (2), in calculating the storage capacity of a storage facility, the absolute space or volume of the storage facility would be counted regardless of the setting of any high-level or overflow alarm established for the storage facility.
For the purposes of paragraph (1)(b)(ii), the total installed capacity of concrete mixers is the total capacity of all concrete mixers installed for the production of concrete.
For the purposes of paragraph (1)(b)(iii), the total hourly concrete production rate is the maximum total production output capacity of concrete per hour. (Amended 5 of 2025 s. 12)
Ceramic Works

td.content: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 2 tonnes or, if the mode of operation is continuous, 0.67 tonne per day, and in which any ceramic products including bricks, tiles, pipes, pottery goods, or refractories are manufactured in furnaces or kilns fired by any fuel.

paragraph.content: Chlorine Works

td.content: Works in which chlorine is made or used in any manufacturing process.

paragraph.content: Copper Works

td.leadIn: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 0.5 tonne (expressed as copper) or, if the mode of operation is continuous, 0.45 tonne (expressed as copper) per hour and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by the application of heat—

subparagraph.content: molten copper is refined; or
copper or copper alloy swarf is degreased; or
copper alloys are recovered from scrap fabricated metal, swarf or residues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: copper or copper alloy is melted and cast.
Electricity Works

td.content: Works in which fossil fuel is burnt either wholly or as part of the process of electricity generation where the installed generation capacity of such works exceeds 5 MW.

paragraph.content: Gas Works

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: coal, coke, oil, carbonaceous material or any mixtures or derivatives of such materials or any waste materials are handled or prepared for carbonization or gasification and in which such materials are carbonized or gasified; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: natural gas is reformed, refined or odorised.
Iron and Steel Works

td.content: Works in which the installed furnace capacity exceeds 1 tonne, or, if the mode of operation is continuous, 1 tonne per hour, and in which a ferrous metal melting process for casting is carried out.

paragraph.content: Metal Recovery Works

td.content: Works in which scrap metals are treated in any type of furnace for recovery of metal with a processing capacity exceeding 50 kg per hour, where this is the primary object of the works.

paragraph.content: Mineral Works

td.leadIn: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 5 000 tonnes per annum and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: metallurgical slags; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pulverised fuel ash; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: minerals, other than moulding sand in foundries or coal at electricity works,

td.continued: are subjected to any size reduction, grading or heating by a process giving rise to dust, not being any works described in any other specified process.

paragraph.content: Incinerators

td.content: Works in which the installed capacity exceeds 0.5 tonne per hour and which are used for the destruction by burning of wastes or refuse, not being any works described in any other specified process.

paragraph.content: Petrochemical Works

td.leadIn: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 100 tonnes per annum (expressed as total chemical products), and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any hydrocarbons are used for the production of olefins or derivatives of olefins; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any olefins, derivatives of olefins or mixture of thereof are used in any chemical manufacturing process, not being any works described in any other specified process; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any olefins, derivatives of olefins or mixture of thereof are polymerised.
Sulphuric Acid Works

td.content: Works in which the installed capacity exceeds 100 tonnes per annum and in which the manufacture of sulphuric acid is carried on by any process, and works for the concentration or distillation of sulphuric acid.

paragraph.content: Tar and Bitumen Works

td.leadIn: Works of the following kinds in which the installed capacity exceeds 250 kg per hour and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: gas tar or coal tar or bitumen is distilled or is heated in any manufacturing process; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any product of the distillation of gas tar or coal tar or bitumen is distilled or heated in any process involving the evolution of any noxious or offensive gas; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: heated materials produced from gas tar or coal tar or bitumen are applied in coating or wrapping of iron or steel pipes or fittings.
Frit Works

td.content: Works in which the installed furnace capacity exceeds 1 tonne and in which frit is made by fusion of materials and quenching.

paragraph.content: Lead Works

td.leadIn: Works of the following kinds in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by application of heat—

subparagraph.content: lead is extracted or recovered from any material containing lead or its compounds; or
lead is refined; or
lead is applied as a surface coating to other metals by spraying; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: compounds of lead are manufactured, extracted, recovered or used in processes which give rise to particulates emission, excluding the manufacture of electric accumulators and the application of glazes or vitreous enamels; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: organic lead compounds are made.
Amines Works

td.leadIn: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 1 000 tonnes per annum and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any methylamine or any ethylamine is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any methylamine or any ethylamine is used in any chemical process.
Asbestos Works

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: raw asbestos is milled, ground, opened or blended prior to use in a manufacturing operation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: asbestos or any material containing asbestos is used in the manufacture of asbestos cement or asbestos cement pipes, or asbestos insulating board, or asbestos textiles, or asbestos jointing or packaging materials, or asbestos brake or clutch materials, or asbestos floor coverings, or fillers or reinforcements.
Chemical Incineration Works

td.leadIn: Works, not being any works described in any other specified process, of the following kinds in which the installed capacity exceeds 25 kg per hour and which are used for the destruction by burning of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wastes produced from chemical manufacturing processes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: chemical wastes containing combined bromine, chlorine, fluorine, iodine, lead, mercury, cadmium, zinc, nitrogen, phosphorus or sulphur; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: wastes produced in the manufacturing of plastics.
Hydrochloric Acid Works

td.content: Works in which the installed capacity exceeds 100 tonnes per annum (expressed as hydrochloric acid) where hydrochloric acid gas is evolved either during the preparation of liquid hydrochloric acid or for use in any manufacturing process or as the result of the use of chlorides in a chemical process.

paragraph.content: Hydrogen Cyanide Works

td.content: Works in which the installed capacity exceeds 100 tonnes per annum and in which hydrogen cyanide is made or used in any chemical manufacture.

paragraph.content: Sulphide Works

td.leadIn: Works of the following kinds and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hydrogen sulphide is evolved by the decomposition of metallic sulphide in any manufacturing process; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hydrogen sulphide is used in the production of such sulphides; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: hydrogen sulphide or mercaptans are made or used in any chemical process or evolved as part of any chemical process.
Pathological Waste Incinerators

td.content: Works in which the installed capacity exceeds 50 kg per hour and which are used for the destruction by burning of any medical, hospital or pathological wastes, not being any works described in any other specified process.

paragraph.content: Organic Chemical Works

td.leadIn: Works, not being a chemical process described in any other specified process, of the following kinds in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the installed capacity exceeds 100 tonnes per annum (expressed as the total organic chemical products), and in which—

subparagraph.content: any organic chemicals, including organic intermediate products, pesticides, fertilisers, and specialty chemicals, are manufactured in any organic chemical process; or
any organic solvent or mixture of solvents is recovered by any thermal process; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any organic liquids, including liquid fuel, are stored in tanks having an installed capacity exceeding 100 m3.
Petroleum Works

td.leadIn: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 100 tonnes per annum (expressed as petroleum product) and in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: crude or stabilised crude petroleum or associated gas, or condensate is—

subparagraph.content: handled or stored; or
refined; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any product of such refining is subjected to further refining or to conversion; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: used lubricating oil is prepared for re-use by any thermal process.
Zinc Galvanising Works

td.content: Works in which the installed capacity exceeds 5 000 tonnes per annum (expressed as galvanised product) and in which zinc galvanising is carried out.

paragraph.content: Rendering Works

td.content: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 250 kg per hour (expressed as the raw material) and in which rendering or reduction or drying through application of heat, or curing by smoking, of animal matter (including feathers, blood, bone, hoof, skin, offal, whole fish, and fish heads and guts and like parts, and organic manures but not including milk or milk products) is carried out.

paragraph.content: Non-ferrous Metallurgical Works

td.content: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 1 tonne per hour and in which melting of any non-ferrous metal, other than aluminium, copper, lead and zinc for galvanising is carried out.

paragraph.content: Glass Works

td.content: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 200 tonnes per annum (expressed as the glass products) and in which manufacturing process for making glass or glass products including mineral fibre and glass fibre is carried out.

paragraph.content: Paint Works

td.content: Works in which the processing capacity exceeds 35 m3 (expressed as coating products) and in which coating products including paints, vanishes and lacquers are produced or manufactured.

section.name: s1
section.content: The place and times or periods at or during which the emission of air pollutants may take place.

section.name: s2
section.content: The design and construction of any chimney or relevant plant or equipment used in connexion with the emission of any air pollutant.

section.name: s3
section.content: The rate of discharge of any air pollutant or total amount thereof in relation to the matter discharged or any constituent thereof.

section.name: s4
section.content: The nature, composition, colour or temperature of the matter discharged or any constituent thereof.

section.name: s5
section.content: The treatment of any potential air pollutant before it is discharged and the chimney or relevant plant or equipment to be provided, maintained and used therefor.

section.name: s6
section.content: The equipment and facilities to be provided for inspecting, sampling or measuring the emission and ambient concentration of any air pollutant or any constituent thereof. (Amended 13 of 1993 s. 34)

section.name: s7
section.content: The maintenance and security of any equipment and facilities referred to in paragraph 6.

section.name: s8
section.content: The provision to the Authority of samples, and of the results of the analysis of samples, of air pollutants or any material that may evolve air pollutants.

section.name: s9

section.name: s10
section.content: The access of authorized officers to the equipment, facilities and records referred to in paragraphs 6 and 9.

section.name: s11

section.name: s1
section.content: A person who claims compensation under section 24 or 25 shall submit to the Authority particulars in writing of his claim.

subsection.leadIn: A claim under paragraph 1 shall be submitted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a licence or exemption is cancelled, within 1 year after the cancellation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a licence or exemption is varied so as to impose additional obligations on either the licence holder or the owner of the premises used for the conduct of the specified process to which the exemption relates, as the case may be within 1 year after the completion of the works attributable solely to the requirement of the Authority.

subsection.content: The period referred to in sub-paragraph (1) may, upon application made to the Chief Executive either before or after the expiry of that period, be extended in accordance with this paragraph.
Notice of an application under sub-paragraph (2) shall be given to the Authority by the applicant.

The Chief Executive may extend the period within which particulars of a claim must be submitted to the Authority if the Chief Executive considers that the delay in submitting the particulars was occasioned by mistake of fact or mistake of any matter of law (other than the matters contained in subparagraph (1)) or by any other reasonable cause or that the Government is not materially prejudiced by the delay.

An extension may be granted by the Chief Executive under subparagraph (4) with or without conditions for such period as the Chief Executive thinks fit but not in any case exceeding 6 years from the time when the right to compensation first arose.

section.name: s3
section.content: If the Authority and the claimant do not agree on the settlement or compromise of the claim within 3 months of the submission or particulars under paragraph 1, the claimant may notify the Authority that he desires a reference to the Lands Tribunal and the Authority shall thereupon refer the claim with the particulars thereof to the Lands Tribunal.

subsection.content: The Lands Tribunal may direct that interest be paid on compensation (but not on costs) from such date and for such period as the Lands Tribunal thinks fit, at the rate specified in subparagraph (2) or at such other rate as may be determined by resolution of the Legislative Council. (Amended 6 of 2001 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subparagraph (1), the rate of interest paid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of a working day shall be the lowest of the interest rates paid on deposits at 24 hours’ call by note-issuing banks at the close of business on that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of a non-working day shall be the lowest of the interest rates paid on deposits at 24 hours’ call by note-issuing banks at the close of business on the last working day before that day. (Added 6 of 2001 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: non-working day (非工作日) means a day that is not a working day;
note-issuing bank (發鈔銀行) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Legal Tender Notes Issue Ordinance (Cap. 65);

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means any day other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public holiday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined in section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1). (Added 6 of 2001 s. 7)

editorialNote.content: * For the validation of interest payments and application provisions relating to the amendments made by 6 of 2001, see section 13 of 6 of 2001.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Air Quality Objectives
schedule.editorialNote: Editorial Note:For the transitional provisions relating to an application under section 13(1) of the Environmental Impact Assessment Ordinance (Cap. 499), see section 4 of the Air Pollution Control (Amendment) Ordinance 2021 (6 of 2021).

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: respirable suspended particulates (可吸入懸浮粒子) means suspended particles in air with a nominal aerodynamic diameter of 10 μm or less.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application
section.content: The air quality objectives set out in this Schedule are prescribed for every air control zone.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Reference conditions
section.content: All measurements of the concentration of gaseous air pollutants set out in Part 2 of this Schedule are to be adjusted to a reference temperature of 293 Kelvin and a reference pressure of 101.325 kilopascal.

subsection.content: The concentration limit of sulphur dioxide in air averaged over a reference period is 500 μg/m³ and the number of reference periods in which the limit is exceeded should not be more than 3 per calendar year.

The concentration limit of sulphur dioxide in air averaged over a day is 40 μg/m³ and the number of days on which the limit is exceeded should not be more than 3 per calendar year. (Amended 6 of 2021 s. 3; 5 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a reference period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first 10 minutes of a day; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each successive 10-minute period of the day.

subsection.content: The concentration limit of respirable suspended particulates in air averaged over a day is 75 μg/m³ and the number of days on which the limit is exceeded should not be more than 9 per calendar year.
The concentration of respirable suspended particulates in air averaged over a calendar year should not exceed 30 μg/m³.
The concentration limit of fine suspended particulates in air averaged over a day is 37.5 μg/m³ and the number of days on which the limit is exceeded should not be more than 18 per calendar year.
The concentration of fine suspended particulates in air averaged over a calendar year should not exceed 15 μg/m³.
The concentration limit of nitrogen dioxide in air averaged over an hour is 200 μg/m³ and the number of hours in which the limit is exceeded should not be more than 18 per calendar year.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The concentration limit of nitrogen dioxide in air averaged over a day is 120 μg/m³ and the number of days on which the limit is exceeded should not be more than 9 per calendar year. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 13)
The concentration of nitrogen dioxide in air averaged over a calendar year should not exceed 40 μg/m³.
The number of days on which the maximum daily 8-hour mean concentration of ozone in air exceeds 160 μg/m³ should not be more than 9 per calendar year.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The peak season concentration of ozone in air of a calendar year should not exceed 100 μg/m³. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1A), the peak season concentration of ozone in air of a calendar year is the highest value of the 6-month running averages in the year calculated by averaging the maximum daily 8-hour mean concentration of ozone in air within the 6-month period concerned. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Each 6-month running average calculated for the purposes of subsection (1B) is assigned to the third month (specified month) of the 6-month period, that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first 6-month calculation period of a calendar year is the period beginning on 1 November of the calendar year immediately before the calendar year and ending on 30 April of that calendar year, and the specified month of that period is the period beginning on 1 January and ending on 31 January; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the last 6-month calculation period of a calendar year is the period beginning on 1 October of the calendar year and ending on 31 March of the following calendar year, and the specified month of that period is the period beginning on 1 December and ending on 31 December of that calendar year. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (1B), the maximum daily 8-hour mean concentration of ozone in air is selected by examining 8-hour running averages, calculated from hourly data and updated each hour. (Amended 5 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: Each 8-hour running average calculated for the purposes of subsection (2) is assigned to the day on which the 8-hour period ends, that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first calculation period for a day is the period from 5 p.m. on the previous day to 1 a.m. on that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the last calculation period for a day is the period from 4 p.m. to 12 midnight on that day.

subsection.content: The concentration of carbon monoxide in air averaged over an hour should not exceed 30 000 μg/m³.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The concentration of carbon monoxide in air averaged over a day should not exceed 4 000 μg/m³. (Added 5 of 2025 s. 13)
The maximum daily 8-hour mean concentration of carbon monoxide in air should not exceed 10 000 μg/m³.

For the purposes of subsection (2), the maximum daily 8-hour mean concentration of carbon monoxide in air is selected by examining 8-hour running averages, calculated from hourly data and updated each hour.

subsection.leadIn: Each 8-hour running average calculated for the purposes of subsection (3) is assigned to the day on which the 8-hour period ends, that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first calculation period for a day is the period from 5 p.m. on the previous day to 1 a.m. on that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the last calculation period for a day is the period from 4 p.m. to 12 midnight on that day.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Lead
section.content: The concentration of lead in air averaged over a calendar year should not exceed 0.5 μg/m³.
